body_html:
I merged this PR locally with tensorflow master branch, and tried to build it with configure "build tensorflow with tensorRT support: [y/N] y"
While building tensorflow from source, I got this error msg:
TensorRT library version detected from /mnt/evanlu.lyf/tensorRT/TensorRT-3.0.0/include/NvInfer.h (4 //!<.0 //!<.0 //!<) does not match TF_TENSORRT_VERSION (4.0.0). To fix this rerun configure again.
Is this PR is currently only internal for NV developers using tensorRT 4.0 version ?

I just wondering, if it is possible to use tensorRT 3.0 instead? since v3.0 is released, then I could test this new feature locally.
body_text:
I merged this PR locally with tensorflow master branch, and tried to build it with configure "build tensorflow with tensorRT support: [y/N] y"
While building tensorflow from source, I got this error msg:
TensorRT library version detected from /mnt/evanlu.lyf/tensorRT/TensorRT-3.0.0/include/NvInfer.h (4           //!<.0          //!<.0          //!<) does not match TF_TENSORRT_VERSION (4.0.0). To fix this rerun configure again.
Is this PR is currently only internal for NV developers using tensorRT 4.0 version ?
I just wondering, if it is possible to use tensorRT 3.0 instead? since v3.0 is released, then I could test this new feature locally.
body:
I merged this PR locally with tensorflow master branch, and tried to build it with configure "build tensorflow with tensorRT support: [y/N] y"
While building tensorflow from source, I got this error msg: 
TensorRT library version detected from /mnt/evanlu.lyf/tensorRT/TensorRT-3.0.0/include/NvInfer.h (4           //!<.0          //!<.0          //!<) does not match TF_TENSORRT_VERSION (4.0.0). To fix this rerun configure again.
Is this PR is currently only internal for NV developers using tensorRT 4.0 version ?

I just wondering, if it is possible to use tensorRT 3.0 instead? since v3.0 is released, then I could test this new feature locally.
